title: Cromartie V. the God Shiva: Acting Through the Government of India
description: Set in London and on south India's Coromandel Coast, a moving story about art, religion, love, class, race, and greed is based on a real case ten years ago, when an international incident over the ownership of a priceless bronze statue resulted in the God Shiva becoming the plaintiff in a lawsuit.
author: Rumer Godden
